block.p: Emily Dora Blank and Alexander Eric Appelbaum are to be married this evening at American Park at the Battery, a restaurant in Manhattan. Rabbi Lawrence Kushner is to perform the ceremony.

The bride, 29, is keeping her name. She is the director of community organizing at the Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation, a social services agency in Brooklyn. She graduated from Brown University and received a master's degree in social work from Hunter College. She is the daughter of Susan and Charles Blank of Brooklyn. Her father is a history teacher and the director of student activities at Friends Seminary in Manhattan. Her mother is a writing and editing consultant for nonprofit organizations.

The bridegroom, 29, is known as Alec. He is a writer at Money magazine in Manhattan. He received a bachelor's degree and an M.B.A. from Yale. He is the son of Judith and Alan Appelbaum of Bedford, N.Y. His mother is an owner of Sensible Solutions, a book marketing company in Mount Kisco, and an author of ''How to Get Happily Published'' (HarperCollins, 1998). His father is of counsel to Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton, the law firm in Manhattan.

The bridegroom's maternal grandmother, Harriet F. Pilpel, a lawyer and civil libertarian, was the general counsel to the American Civil Liberties Union and the Planned Parenthood Federation of America.
